verbs.description: six washington childern [V: hospitalized] [ARGM-PRP: with mysterious illness] a rare nervous system disorder has left six children paralyzed the condition is called acute flaccid myelitis or afm which attacks the nervous system particularly the spinal cord and can lead to arm or leg weakness and loss of muscle reflexes olympia centers for disease control and prevention pierce snohomish cdc lewis washington myelitis skagit county washington wash dr scott lindquist dr scott lindquist skagit county department of health united states department of health and human services
